about.title: Why We Sing
about.subtitle: The Philosophy behind Sing by Hearts
about.sec1_desc: Singing in a choir as a hobby is wonderful. But dragging yourself to practice after a long day of work, faced with tiny scores and unfamiliar lyrics, can be stressful. The fear of making mistakes often overshadows the joy. We started with a question: <1>Can't the preparation process be as fun as a festival?</1>
about.sec2_desc: Choral perfection comes from eye contact with the conductor. But if you don't memorize the lyrics, your eyes are trapped in the score, and your ears are closed. Have you ever gone blank when the stage lights hit? <1>Perfect memorization</1> is the only key to turning that fear into <3>excitement</3>.
about.sec3_desc: Sing by Hearts rejects boring rote memorization. We've introduced <1>game mechanics</1> where you fill in the blanks one by one. Beyond just memorizing, share your scores with fellow members and cheer each other on. It's not a lonely battle, but a <3>joyful journey of growing together</3>.
about.sec4_desc: Put down the score and lift your head. Follow the conductor's fingertips and listen to your colleagues' voices. For that thrilling moment, <1>Sing by Hearts</1> will be your reliable pacemaker. Shall we enjoy it together?
